sections.title: Currently Learning
sections.content:
After writing and publishing my first Swift application I recently was able to get my first Android app using Kotlin and Jetpack Compose into the Google Play Store. Since then I am still learning about new functionality and I keep improving my app.

By building my own portfolio website I am most recently learning a lot about React and Next.js.

sections.title: Working On
sections.content:
In cooperation with the "German Museum" in Munich and the LMU I am creating a web application that makes a virtual simplified version of the "Eitz Reinharmonium" accessible to everyone.

In a seminar project at the chair for applied education technologies I am part of a team that builds a new tool for assessing equal contributions of students in university programming assignments by finding useful metrics and LLM-based categorisation of the meaningfulness of student's contributions.

sections.title: Academic Focus
sections.content: As a head TA for "Introduction to Programming" and a TA for "Patterns in Software Engineering" I focus on teaching software engineering concepts to students. Even though this is already my fifth time being a tutor I keep learning new things when interacting with the students. Additionally I am taking two courses in music at the LMU ("Satzlehre" and "Formenlehre") which is not just surprisingly interesting but also broadens my horizon towards humanities.

sections.title: SwimResults
sections.content: My "passion project" SwimResults is a software for swimming competitions that brings live information to the devices of the participants and their friends. Currently I focus on refining the recently publish Android app as well as new tools for simplifying the integration process for new competitions and customers (SwimResults Manager). Therefore I am also working on expanding the supported timing systems and software to support OMEGA systems with CPS-Schwimm.

sections.title: Games
sections.content: Besides my all-time favourite "Minecraft" I recently started a new game in "Red Dead Redemption 2" focusing a lot on the details, small dialogs and encounters that I did not notice when playing the game the first time. I also started a new world in "Transport Fever 2" not just to build a large railway system on a bigger map but also to manage my excitement for the upcoming 3rd iteration of the game.
